title: Whats the point in help desk if staff refuse to address questions?
body:
Chat started: 2017-09-10 12:11 AM UTC

(12:11:19 AM) Twisted Spade: Hi there 
(12:11:41 AM) *** Rocco joined the chat *** 
(12:11:42 AM) Rocco: hi there 
(12:11:54 AM) Twisted Spade: I'm having a bit of a problem with some riot staff members 
(12:12:04 AM) Twisted Spade: I feel as if I'm being targeted and not being treated fairly 
(12:12:15 AM) Twisted Spade: Its very disheartening to be treated so badly 
(12:12:24 AM) Rocco: oh i see. i'm sorry to hear that 
(12:12:27 AM) Rocco: :/ 
(12:12:31 AM) Twisted Spade: Yeah so am I honestly 
(12:12:48 AM) Twisted Spade: You know if Cammy White is on staff today? 
(12:12:56 AM) Twisted Spade: I've talked to him/her in the past and they treated me with respect 
(12:13:02 AM) Rocco: oh okay 
(12:13:04 AM) Twisted Spade: I didn't feel like I was garbage to them 
(12:13:14 AM) Twisted Spade: while I do feel like I am being treated as garbage from other staff 
(12:13:21 AM) Twisted Spade: as in desposeable 
(12:13:22 AM) Rocco: unfortunately they are not on livechat at the moment 
(12:13:25 AM) Twisted Spade: something easily thrown away 
(12:13:36 AM) Rocco: hey you are not! we appreciate you 
(12:13:44 AM) Rocco: do you have any questions we can help you answer? 
(12:13:50 AM) Twisted Spade: I had hoped you would seeing how I'm your customer and have been playing since season one 
(12:14:06 AM) Twisted Spade: Sure I got some questions but questions get me into trouble 
(12:14:10 AM) Twisted Spade: staff dislike questions I find lol 
(12:14:12 AM) Twisted Spade: But I'll try one 
(12:14:51 AM) Twisted Spade: Is it legitimate for a staff member to refuse to address direct questions and then ban a players account from accessing help desk chat due to being unwilling to address their questions or talk to them when they have legitimate concerns and questions? 
(12:15:27 AM) Rocco: i feel that's a very pointed and circumstantial question 
(12:15:55 AM) Rocco: but, if the player's concern and issue has been addressed, even if it's the answer they do not like, and the player continues to bring it up, yes i would say so 
(12:16:31 AM) Twisted Spade: That's not the situation however. 
(12:16:48 AM) Twisted Spade: I could paste it to you 
(12:16:53 AM) Twisted Spade: but you prob would think its too long 
(12:17:02 AM) Rocco: yeah it's best to keep them direct 
(12:17:04 AM) Twisted Spade: all staff do 
(12:17:09 AM) Twisted Spade: direct messages? 
(12:17:14 AM) Rocco: questions 
(12:17:16 AM) Twisted Spade: I'm talking about the conversation between me and gunny 
(12:17:34 AM) Rocco: i see 
(12:17:43 AM) Twisted Spade: I don't think its right I can ask a question he refuse's to address and be cut off from all future ability to access help 
(12:18:02 AM) Twisted Spade: Some of your staff are really helpful like Cammy White 
(12:18:13 AM) Twisted Spade: While others like agent007 and gunny have zero interest in understanding or helping 
(12:18:39 AM) Twisted Spade: The proof is that they will repeat things back to you that you don't support, as if you said your in support of them 
(12:18:46 AM) Twisted Spade: conversation brakes down quickly when they are not even trying 
(12:19:31 AM) Rocco: i don't think it's interest, although that may be your perceptive. some talk/respond in different ways, and it's normal to feel different things about different people but i feel like they do answer questions/concerns 
(12:20:09 AM) Twisted Spade: Okay well if its not interest then their reading comprehension is so low that they shouldn't be working in text 
(12:21:02 AM) Twisted Spade: I honestly don't mind how you want to describe it, the fact is they don't read and they don't respond on subject and if you press the subject they will close your requests and treat you as if you've done something wrong by trying to get them to address something they wish to ignore 
(12:21:38 AM) Twisted Spade: I don't feel like I should be punished and banned from help desk due to their inability to read and respond on subject to the point where I need to correct them and repeat myself cuz they are refusing to read it 
(12:22:12 AM) Rocco: okay and it's fine to have your own opinion but if we have talked to you multiple times about the situation and responded, and you continue to write in about the same situation, we do ban players from chat 
(12:22:26 AM) Twisted Spade: That's not what happened tho 
(12:22:30 AM) Twisted Spade: he sent me maybe 3 messages? 
(12:22:37 AM) Twisted Spade: He didn't even try 
(12:22:52 AM) Rocco: also i will only really be able to help you if you have questions for me about the game, etc. :/ because as much as i would like to listen, i do have to help other players as well 
(12:22:59 AM) Twisted Spade: And what does this even solve? I mean im talking to you right now am I not? 
(12:23:09 AM) Twisted Spade: What good is banning me from help desk if I can just make a new account? 
(12:23:54 AM) Twisted Spade: .... I want to know what I can do about this staff member unreasonably punishing me for requesting help and clarity they refused to give me 
(12:24:03 AM) Twisted Spade: How can I be a reformed player if you guys refuse to talk to me about what else I can do ? 
(12:24:58 AM) Rocco: if you are banned from the livechat, you can always write in through tickets 
(12:25:00 AM) Twisted Spade: closing my requests and telling me to go play doesn't change anything 
(12:25:09 AM) Twisted Spade: Tickets are trash, they get auto closed 
(12:25:22 AM) Rocco: again that's your opinion but that is the what else you can do 
(12:25:37 AM) Twisted Spade: Its not a opinion, its fact, my tickets get closed regardless of what I have to say automatically 
(12:26:12 AM) Twisted Spade: How do you turn me into a reformed player if your company refuses to address anything? 
(12:26:28 AM) Twisted Spade: IF my help requests for understanding is denied, how do I reform? 
(12:27:16 AM) Rocco: you can reform by not being toxic in the future and playing to win the game 
(12:27:19 AM) Twisted Spade: If my requests are closed and I'm treated as if I'm doing something for simply asking, how does that change my point of view for the better? 
(12:27:24 AM) Twisted Spade: Can you define toxic? 
(12:27:41 AM) Twisted Spade: As far as I'm aware its undefined so you can use it as a blanket term to use on anything you want 
(12:27:56 AM) Twisted Spade: If beauty is in the eye of the beholder, then the person who is observing gets to decide what is beautiful. This means you guys can say anything is toxic. 
(12:28:24 AM) Twisted Spade: Me asking a question you guys refuse to address is toxic right? 
(12:28:32 AM) Twisted Spade: I mean your company punished me for it 
(12:28:35 AM) Rocco: being negative, complaining, giving up, hate speech, berating, fighting back, etc. 
(12:28:44 AM) Rocco: you were only punished because of your behavior 
(12:28:46 AM) Twisted Spade: I'm complaining maybe but legitimately. 
(12:29:15 AM) Rocco: and i'm sorry that you do not agree with that, but solely your actions were the reason why your account received a punishment 
(12:29:19 AM) Twisted Spade: alright man ill humor you 
(12:29:23 AM) Twisted Spade: can you point out what I said or did wrong? 
(12:29:24 AM) Twisted Spade: #31690227 
(12:29:58 AM) Twisted Spade: cuz I'm punished for something I'm clueless as to what I did legitimately wrong, I asked a question and gave context and information on that subject, nothing more 
(12:30:24 AM) Twisted Spade: I mean if you want to punish me at least let me know why 
(12:31:08 AM) Twisted Spade: Cuz from my point of view I have a unaddressed question asking what else I could do in that situation and then describing how the other options will either see me punished or offer zero success rate. 
(12:31:29 AM) Twisted Spade: If you guys want me to do something else, please, elaborate on what it is you would wish for me to do instead of closing my help requests repeatedly and leaving me ignorant. 
(12:32:17 AM) Rocco: what is your question 
(12:32:28 AM) Twisted Spade: My question is what did I do wrong in help request ticket #31690227 
(12:33:03 AM) Twisted Spade: What did I do to warrant being punished for asking for questions to help me go back into the game as a reformed player by having you elaborate on what else I could do in those situations 
(12:34:45 AM) Rocco: because you do not have questions, you just do not like how our system works and we cannot change that solely for you. and you continue to give us feedback, which is great, but we ask you to go to the boards and instead of giving questions, you are being rude and attacking us. 
(12:35:01 AM) Twisted Spade: ?? Do you have a search function? Search for the question mark if you cant find it... 
(12:35:11 AM) Rocco: if you do not have any new questions, i will have to close out this chat and ban you from it as well. 
(12:35:26 AM) Twisted Spade: " 
My question is what did I do wrong in help request ticket #31690227?" 
(12:35:40 AM) Twisted Spade: "What did I do to warrant being punished for asking for questions?" 
(12:36:26 AM) Rocco: i already answered your question in my previous response. because you did not have any new questions for me, i will be banning you from chat now.







Twisted Spade
Today at 17:39
 

Is this some kind of a joke? 

Can I talk to someone else then I feel as if your making a point to refuse to look into this situation or address my concerns.

replies.body:
It looks like you continue to abuse the support system continually for submitting feedback/requests to the team. That's not the proper channel - support is for "something is not how it should be please fix it", not for ideas on how to improve anything (the game, punishments, etc).

Further, people oftentimes don't listen to support when they explain things, just because they don't like the answer. You can ask questions to support, but if you ask the same question after it's already been answered by them, just cause you don't like the answer, then yes, they will revoke your access.

So you just skim so you can read your own text?

Cuz you sure didn't read this text.

I mean alternatively if you think they addressed my question can you point out where I was given any information on my help request #31690227 that I asked him to address?

> (12:34:45 AM) Rocco: because you do not have questions, you just do not like how our system works and we cannot change that solely for you. and you continue to give us feedback, which is great, but we ask you to go to the boards and instead of giving questions, you are being rude and attacking us.

> [{quoted}](name=Chermorg,realm=NA,application-id=ZGEFLEUQ,discussion-id=eec8jrEK,comment-id=000000000000,timestamp=2017-09-10T00:57:07.066+0000)
>
> 
That is AFTER he refused to address my question requesting him to tell me what I did wrong in the linked help request, he never once even looked at it.

Just cuz he says I don't have a question doesn't make it reality, I obviously asked the question again right after that and he again refused to address it.

> [{quoted}](name=Deep Terror Nami,realm=NA,application-id=ZGEFLEUQ,discussion-id=eec8jrEK,comment-id=000000000001,timestamp=2017-09-10T00:58:55.191+0000)
>
> I read the entire thing, and almost all of it was just telling him how you didn't like the other support member's responses. It's not possible for us to help you here without the context of what was actually in that ticket of yours; if you can post that for us, maybe we can give you a different perspective on the matter.

"just telling him how you didn't like the other support member's responses."

No, I was commenting on how they REFUSED to respond and then banned me, I was asking them to look into the situation and tell me what I did wrong.

He literally addressed it.

If you post your support ticket here as DTN suggested we can help you identify why Rocco felt that way.

> [{quoted}](name=Chermorg,realm=NA,application-id=ZGEFLEUQ,discussion-id=eec8jrEK,comment-id=00000000000000000000,timestamp=2017-09-10T01:14:38.021+0000)
>
> He literally addressed it.
> 
> If you post your support ticket here as DTN suggested we can help you identify why Rocco felt that way.

Ticket #31690943 Is with rocco as pasted above. I reopened it and rocco closed it then banned me from reopening new requests, so not only am I banned from text chat now I am also banned from opening help requests.... All over me asking them to address a complex question they refused to do? This isn't right, I have done nothing wrong, I am not under punishment for any in game actions, so I should not be punished for asking questions requesting clarity and context on riots stance so I don't brake anymore rules.

Ticket #31690227 is the orginal ticket between me and gunny, it was obvious gunny had zero intentions of even reading what I had to say let alone help or try to understand what I was asking so he could respond to me.

I feel like there are two types of staff, staff who skim and don't care about the game or the players who are there for a pay check like rocco, gunny and agent007, while there are others like Cammy White who have a high level reading comprehension who are able to follow a conversation and respond on point cuz they care about doing their job properly since they care about the game and the players.

One will try to help you, the other will treat you like a criminal for asking questions and requesting clarity or context if they don't want to address it it becomes a you problem, they turn you into a problem and punish you for it... this ain't right.

You want context on the question I'm asking? Its a simple question really but unless you take all the context into account then you won't be able to address it; the question is what else can you do in a situation of a trolling or griefing in actions player if all options equal either punishment from riot or a zero success rate. While the only one that has a success rate above 1% (team communication) is punishable, it remains the only option with a postiive sucess rate. So if its the only option, but your still punished for it as if you shouldn't be doing it, what other options are there that riot would wish for me to use instead of team communication when dealing with trolling or griefing actions or another player?

I mean theres a group on facebook (two of them actually each a bit different) where there are tens of thousands of players trolling and griefing in actions daily... More information found here:
https://boards.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/player-behavior-moderation/5Tozc4Pj-rules-of-trolling-getting-popular

Heres another forums post I made with a conversation highlighting some of the issues with this (and this staff member agrees with me and promises to do something about it)

> Ticket #31690227 is the orginal ticket between me and gunny, it was obvious gunny had zero intentions of even reading what I had to say let alone help or try to understand what I was asking so he could respond to me.

Please post this ticket - we can't determine if Rocco responded appropriately until we can determine if Rocco was correct in saying that your past ticket was handled and your questions answered. We can't determine that until you post the ticket.

You are doing the same exact thing to us here you did to Rocco - Rocco gave you an answer and you didn't like it, thus you started being an ass. Please post your original ticket (with gunny) so we can see where it all started.

Is this a joke? Go read the above message I have both numbers in the above post, I can't force you to read them.....

And if you don't read my posts how can you ever understand me?

If you don't absorb the words and I don't absorb your words, then how do we transfer information from one to the other? We don't....

#We can't access them

As I've stated before, we need you to go post a copy. Support tickets are not public.

Your not staff?

Why do you need access?

Staff can get access and are welcome to check it out via the number I gave them.

I would paste it here BUT I AM UNABLE TO since the message is too long for a reply message.

Screenshots should work..

Also, you came to the boards I presumed to get input from people *outside* the staff you had an issue with.

It's like, do you want us to help or not? If you want a response from staff, you already got it, Rocco said you were in the wrong before.

No I'm here to get in contact with staff, you can't do anything to help the situation at all and its obvious you don't want to so I'm unsure why your here if you have zero ability to do anything about this yet are offering nothing constructive, as if I should humor you cuz you have a forums account?

I'm not into taking a bunch of screen shots and wasting more time on someone who can't do anything about the situation, as I said, any riot staff can access them through the numbers I gave and since your not staff and unable to do anything about this or bring anything constructive to the conversation I would hope this is our last message with each other since your obviously not trying to understand the situation but post blame on me.

Well, that's certainly your prerogative.  Though I surmise that if you were to post your logs, you would only confirm what I and most of the other people on this board already know, which is that your communications are not as neutral as you would have us believe, and that while -you- don't think your communications are toxic, we agree with Riot that they are.

The thing is, I, numerous other players, and Support have already told you that the recourse for trolls and griefers is to mute and report them afterwards.

This goes back to literally my very first post in this thread.

NOTHING, ABSOLUTELY NOTHING you say in game will "deal with in game trolling or griefers."  You cannot talk a troll or griefer out of trolling or griefing.  They're not, as you've pointed out, in your Rules of Trolling post, oblivious to the rules.  They are making conscious decisions to break them.

Anyone on this board could have told you this, and I'm sure support did too.  Arguing with the trolls and griefers only worsens the experience for the other players on your team, which is why it's deemed toxic, and why you're told to mute and report.

You were banned from tickets and the chat because you are asking the same question over and over and over again just because you don't like the response.

Logs of.... my chat between a staff member and myself in help desk chat... NOT in a game?

What.

Do you not understand how ill logical this is that I'm being punished NOT FOR IN GAME ACTIONS but rather for requesting clarity and context on a situation that has NOTHING to do with any in game punishments?

 I'm not trying to get a in game punishment turned around, why do you seem to think I was toxic?

I'm trying to get them to address the subject of what else can be done in these situations if team communication is the only solution but you'll also be punished for using it. AGain I will repeat that I was not requesting them to remove a punishment or even talking about a punishment of mine UNTILL they punished me for using the help desk to ask for clarification and context on a subject I feel I will get punished for again in the future due to riot refusing to address this obvious issue that there is no other solution aside of in game communication to deal with in game trolling or griefing players... But me talking about that should be punished cuz they don't have a reply? I don't agree that I should be punished for asking questions OUT OF THE GAME to people who refuse to address them, their job is to offer clarity and context on the way riot staff handles situations, thats exactly what I was requesting from them but being denied to the point where they punished me for asking questions.... then punished me again for asking what I did wrong to get myself punished for asking questions.

But you won't read any of that and your gona reply again accusing me of being in the wrong somehow even tho this isn't a in game punishment, this is a asking questions in help desk punishment, this isn't from me being toxic in game like you want to pretend and insinuate, this is from me asking a question that people refuse to address most likely since they don't have a way to address it.
^ exactly this. I read the whole discussion and your question was answered with this statement. The person you spoke was very patient with you. Cannot fault the staff at all.

> [{quoted}](name=Soulhavok,realm=OCE,application-id=ZGEFLEUQ,discussion-id=eec8jrEK,comment-id=0000000000000001,timestamp=2017-09-10T01:12:27.385+0000)
>
> ^ exactly this. I read the whole discussion and your question was answered with this statement. The person you spoke was very patient with you. Cannot fault the staff at all.

> [{quoted}](name=Chermorg,realm=NA,application-id=ZGEFLEUQ,discussion-id=eec8jrEK,comment-id=00000000000000000000,timestamp=2017-09-10T01:14:38.021+0000)
>
> He literally addressed it.
> 
> If you post your support ticket here as DTN suggested we can help you identify why Rocco felt that way.

"He literally addressed it."

How? I don't see him talking about anything to do with why I was banned from chat text, hes asking for the number, I gave it to him and then he doesn't even look into it, he asks me for a question avoiding the entire thing.

I guess you don't read either? The number is right there.

(12:35:26 AM) Twisted Spade: "
My question is what did I do wrong in help request ticket #31690227?"
(12:35:40 AM) Twisted Spade: "What did I do to warrant being punished for asking for questions?"
(12:36:26 AM) Rocco: i already answered your question in my previous response. because you did not have any new questions for me, i will be banning you from chat now.

He looked at it. Rocco says you:

> do not have questions, you just do not like how our system works and we cannot change that solely for you.

and when you don't get the answer you want you

> are being rude and attacking us

> [{quoted}](name=Chermorg,realm=NA,application-id=ZGEFLEUQ,discussion-id=eec8jrEK,comment-id=000000000000000100000000,timestamp=2017-09-10T01:19:17.560+0000)
>
> He looked at it. Rocco says you:
> 
> and when you don't get the answer you want you

I love how your taking this out of context.

I had a question and he avoided it 110%

(12:35:26 AM) Twisted Spade: "
My question is what did I do wrong in help request ticket #31690227?"
(12:35:40 AM) Twisted Spade: "What did I do to warrant being punished for asking for questions?"

The answer I was looking for was "this is what you did" not "if you don't have a question I'm banning you"

And you might think me being assertive is negative somehow but the reality is that I was pointing out the reality of how he was refusing to address my questions, if he didn't refuse to address my questions then I would have no grounds to point that reality out.

You asked what you did wrong in your ticket with gunny.

His answer was:

>you just do not like how our system works and we cannot change that solely for you. and you continue to give us feedback, which is great, but we ask you to go to the boards and instead of giving questions, you are being rude and attacking us.

More than likely what happened is this: You gave feedback. They asked you to go to boards. You kept extending the ticket with more replies after this, and you were rude to them when they said they can't really take feedback in private conversations on the support system.

#Please post copies of the ticket with gunny so we can see exactly what happened

You failing to post said ticket really makes it look like you're hiding something.

I read the entire thing, and almost all of it was just telling him how you didn't like the other support member's responses. It's not possible for us to help you here without the context of what was actually in that ticket of yours; if you can post that for us, maybe we can give you a different perspective on the matter.

> [{quoted}](name=Deep Terror Nami,realm=NA,application-id=ZGEFLEUQ,discussion-id=eec8jrEK,comment-id=000000000001,timestamp=2017-09-10T00:58:55.191+0000)
>
> I read the entire thing, and almost all of it was just telling him how you didn't like the other support member's responses. It's not possible for us to help you here without the context of what was actually in that ticket of yours; if you can post that for us, maybe we can give you a different perspective on the matter.

"almost all of it was just telling him how you didn't like the other support member's responses."

Sounds like you could use some work on your reading comprehension buddy!

I never once said I didn't like his response, I said I wanted to know WHY (as in context and clarity, as per their job description) I was being punished for asking a question in help text when he refused to address my question. Its not that I didn't like his responce, its that he didn't give me one, he avoided the entire subject and then closed and banned me as punishment for even asking for clarity and context? This isn't right that your staff, including yourself can twist around my words and tell me I'm saying something I'm not then try to make me feel bad or punish me for your out of context opinion of what you think I'm saying instead of what is reality? I really dislike how you twisted my words just now and I don't think thats a fair stance from someone who is staff, you should be unbias.

>  I wanted to know WHY I was being punished for asking a question

This was already answered; they locked you out because you refused to respect the answer given to you, and instead were extremely rude and repeatedly opened new requests to try and get a different answer.

You are doing exactly this to us here, and I'm going to say the same thing they did; if you continue to be aggressive and rude to people trying to help you, you will be temporarily banned from here.

It was not, can you please copy and past what you think addressed that question? Cuz again he never even looked at it.

I am not being aggressive, I am frusterated with folks like you taking what I'm saying out of context and trying to flip it on me as if I'm in the wrong for asking the help desk to give me clarity and context as to why they are doing something, instead of repetaedly just closing my requests and telling me I'm in the wrong.

If they want me to do something else in that situaiton, they should tell me that, instead of closing my requests, that offers ZERO clarity and context to the issues... if I had that context or clarity then why would I repeatedly try to get them to address it if they truely did? I wouldn't cuz I would have my questions addressed and I wouldn't need to reask it cuz you guys would've addressed it so we both can move on.. but your company pretends like this is a nonexistant issue and then cuz I bring it up I'm in the wrong and deserve to be punished cuz your company refuses to address a issue cuz you feel its nonexistant? This ain't right.

https://boards.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/player-behavior-moderation/5Tozc4Pj-rules-of-trolling-getting-popular

That is the problem I'm talking about but none of your staff will talk about this or what players can do aside of team communication if team communication is punishable.

> That is the problem I'm talking about but none of your staff will talk about this or what players can do aside of team communication if team communication is punishable.

Communication is only punishable if you are being a jerk; most players use chat/pings in a perfectly acceptable manner, and if you do that you wouldn't be punished, so I don't really understand what you mean by "if team communication is punishable". For clarity's sake, let's define "team communication" as only *useful, relevant, and respectful* forms of communication; telling a teammate "dodge skillshots you fucking idiot" is not going to be considered team communication for this discussion.

Also, in your post you say;

> Rule Three: Troll and grief as hard as possible...And this is ACCEPTED game play from riot

It should be obvious that this is incredibly untrue, and I don't understand why you'd make that claim.

Do you denie that trolls exist then?
https://boards.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/player-behavior-moderation/5Tozc4Pj-rules-of-trolling-getting-popular

Are you under the delusion that your getting any of these people who follow the troll rules?

> [{quoted}](name=Green Spade,realm=NA,application-id=ZGEFLEUQ,discussion-id=eec8jrEK,comment-id=00000000000100000000000000010000,timestamp=2017-09-10T02:41:00.924+0000)
>
> Do you denie that trolls exist then?
> https://boards.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/player-behavior-moderation/5Tozc4Pj-rules-of-trolling-getting-popular
> 
> Are you under the delusion that your getting any of these people who follow the troll rules?

I think the likelihood that someone "following the troll rules" gets penalized by Riot is infinitely greater than the likelihood that you manage to talk them out of it during a game.

Your missing the point here.

Not everybody is a troll or griefer.

Some players are unskilled, unaware or just bad, this is why you talk to them with team communication, pointing out the issue so its brought to light, so you can solve it, correct it or move on from it.

Again you won't know if they are unskilled, unware of their actions, bad, griefing or trolling untill you point out the issue and they reply to you. 

Most of the people I offer in game advise to or point things out to, they accept it, apply it and we win the game, most times they even thank me. But if someone makes the CHOICE to continue to grief or troll without correcting their actions, or even telling you off when you suggest it, how is that your fault for even trying in the first place before they replied confirming they are either going to continue or thanking you and correcting the issue.

I know from personal experience that more times then not team communication will solve the problem and the person will correct their actions or take the advise (maybe not so much in bronze but gold n higher for sure) its actually more rare for someone to take it negatively then it is for someone to apply it, this means that some folks have bad days, bad games, are unskilled or new with a champ or just plain bad sometimes and they need us to point these things out to them. More or less, yes, but the issue with that is that the only way to solve in game players actions such as griefing or trolling is to attempt team communication. Untill you attempt team communication there is no way to know if the player is just bad, unskills or if they are truely attempting to grief or troll. So I think its pretty crazy to punish someone for simply trying to correct that players actions, that is NOT to say that I think flaming is okay, personal attacks, racist or sexist remarks, I obviously do NOT think those are okay or productive AT ALL.

SO

If team communication is the only option to protect from griefing and trolling in actions players, but its punishable (despite there being mute protection) while you have no protection verse these griefing and trolling players, then what else can you do?

Leave game. Riot will punish you. Technical success since you don't have to endure the game anymore.
Team communication. Riot might punish you if they don't accept what your saying, but if they do then the problem is solved, success!
Report after game. Zero effect on in game actions, doesn't change someones actions 10-20 mins previously.
Mute in game. Zero effect on in game actions.
Ping mute. Zero effect on in game actions.
Say and do nothing. Zero success rate since the player will continue to do what they are doing, even if they are bad or unskilled and may have fixed it if you pointed it out.

They assume the person isn't a troll, giving them the benefit of the doubt, they attempt team communication and it doesnt work, yet they are now opening themselves up for punishment in post game for even trying.

There is positive communication, there is neutral communication, and there is negative communication.

Positive communication: Good job, nice try, we'll get it next time.

Neutral communication: Let's Herald.  Let's drag.  Ganking Top.  SS Mid.

Negative communication: Garen is a troll.  Are you trolling?  Stop feeding.

If you assume your teammates are not trolling, your communication remains Positive or Neutral, and you don't get penalized.

Assuming, or even inquiring whether or not your teammate is trolling will do one of two things:

1.  If the teammate is trolling, it will cause him to troll harder, because now he has an audience.  He is getting a rise out of you, which is what he want.s

2.  If the teammate is not trolling, now he is annoyed with you in addition with being annoyed with himself for making the error(s) in the first place.

In either case, your other 3 teammates have now had to listen to both of you talk about whether the other guy is a troll or not, a negative experience for them as well.

Not sure I agree with you. Negative and toxic are both undefined for a reason, so they can be blanket applied to any situation. As we both know riot looks at conversations one sided so everything your saying is taken out of context.

If beauty is in the eye of the beholder, then the person who is observing gets to decide what is beautiful. A common saying is "Beauty is in the eye of the beholder," which means beauty doesn't exist on its own but is created by observers.

I feel toxic and negative are exactly the same since they can be applied to anything riot wishes to apply them to, thats the nature of a undefined word, it can be applied to anything cuz it has no definition to define itself from.

While I agree that your "type" of negative chat is not good, it is again a undefined word that is applied to anything, so while we can both agree that what your saying is negative, it can ALSO be applied to many situations we would both agree are NOT negative.
